abstract: The police said the thieves had intentionally set off alarms to lure guards into disabling a sensor in the National Art Gallery in Athens.
lead_paragraph: It took thieves all of seven minutes to slip in through a balcony door and steal paintings by Picasso and Mondrian from the National Art Gallery in Athens on Monday, Tthe Associated Press reported. The police said that the burglars intentionally set off alarms Sunday evening to lure guards into disabling a sensor in the museum. One alarm did subsequently go off, but the guards arrived too late to catch a thief.

headline.main: Thieves Steal Picasso and Mondrian Paintings in Athens
